{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the clinical presentation of the infant, including the productive cough, watery stools, white plaques in the oral cavity, and rales on cardiopulmonary examination, the most likely diagnosis is pertussis. Pertussis is a highly contagious respiratory infection caused by the bacterium Bordetella pertussis. The classic symptoms of pertussis include paroxysmal cough, post-tussive emesis, and inspiratory whoop. The presence of lymphadenopathy further supports the diagnosis.
